elements.title: white-lipped peccaries (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that groups of white-lipped peccaries (pictured) can drive away jaguars with their screaming and clacking of teeth?

elements.title: Delaware Straight-Out Truth Teller (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the only purpose of the Delaware Straight-Out Truth Teller was to promote a political candidate?

elements.title: Yama Wayama (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that as a senior in high school, manga artist Yama Wayama began drawing male–male romance manga as a hobby?

elements.title: Windows 2.1 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Windows 2.1 was the first version of Microsoft Windows to require a hard disk drive?

elements.title: Sarah Clarke (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sarah Clarke was the first female president of the British Cardiovascular Society?

elements.title: a TV station in New Jersey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a radio astronomy facility in Illinois objected to the establishment of a TV station in New Jersey?

elements.title: Vecihi Hürkuş (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Turkish aviation pioneer Vecihi Hürkuş had to transport his second plane to Prague just to get it certified?

elements.title: a brief to the U.S. Supreme Court (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Onion said in a brief to the U.S. Supreme Court that "the federal judiciary is staffed entirely by total Latin dorks"?
